title: Romney Delivers a Harsh Rebuke of Obama at Final Stop on Bus Tour
content:
In a CBS interview on Wednesday , Mitt Romney continued his harsh rebuke of the Obama administration , charging that President Obama is running a campaign of “ enmity and jealousy and anger and this is not in my view what the American people want to see . ”
“ The president seems to be running just to hang onto power , ” he added . “ I think he ’ ll do anything in his power to try and get re-elected . ”
The remarks repeated the Republican presidential candidate ’ s tough language on Tuesday night , when he said that the Obama campaign ’ s negative campaign tactics have “ disgraced the presidency . ”
In a speech that was striking in its stinging sweep , which aides said was animated by personal frustration with the recent tone of the race , Mr. Romney lashed out at attacks that he called “ wild and reckless . ”
“ His campaign strategy is to smash America apart and then cobble together 51 percent of the pieces , ” Mr. Romney said . “ If an American president wins that way , we all lose . ”
By criticizing the Obama campaign ’ s tone , Mr. Romney is also able to distract the political debate away from his new running mate , Representative Paul D. Ryan , and his plan to overhaul Medicare .
The Obama campaign ’ s latest offense , Mr. Romney said , came on Tuesday , when Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. delivered a speech in Iowa . Mr. Biden mocked Mr. Romney for seeking to undo regulations on big banks . “ Unchain Wall Street , ” the vice president said . “ They ’ re going to put y ’ all back in chains. ” Later , an Obama aide said the White House stood by those provocative words .
Standing in front of a stately town hall here in central Ohio , under a giant banner that read “ Victory in Ohio , ” Mr. Romney called Mr. Biden ’ s claim “ another outrageous charge . ”
“ This is what an angry and desperate presidency looks like , ” he said .
In a personal dig that he wrote at the last minute Tuesday afternoon , Mr. Romney told the president to “ take your campaign of division and anger and hate back to Chicago and let us get about rebuilding and reuniting America . ”
Mr. Romney and Mr. Obama have traded barbs for months , but the intensity and frequency of the punch-counterpunch have picked up considerably in the past few weeks , belying talk of an elevated discussion of big ideas that both the Romney and Obama campaigns have promised .
In July , a top Obama campaign aide said Mr. Romney might have committed a felony when he signed corporate documents claiming he was chief executive of Bain Capital when he had taken a leave of absence . This month , Mr. Romney made the dubious claim that Mr. Obama is trying to strip all work requirements from welfare programs . Last week , a “ super PAC ” supporting Mr. Obama released a misleading advertisement suggesting that Mr. Romney ’ s actions at Bain Capital indirectly contributed to a woman ’ s death .
On Tuesday night here , Mr. Romney said that Mr. Obama had squandered the optimism and hope that had infused his decisive victory in 2008 .
“ In 2008 , Candidate Obama said , ‘ If you don ’ t have any fresh ideas , then you use stale tactics to scare voters. ’ He said , ‘ If you don ’ t have a record to run on , then you paint your opponent as someone people should run from. ’ And that , he told us , is how ‘ You make a big election about small things . ’ ”
Mr. Romney continued : “ That was candidate Obama describing the strategy that is the now the heart of his campaign . ”
A spokesman for Mr. Obama , Ben LaBolt , accused Mr. Romney of hypocrisy . His remarks , he said , are “ particularly strange coming at a time when he ’ s pouring tens of millions of dollars into negative ads that are demonstrably false . ”
